abstract: It is unknown whether the disease is widespread or a blip, researchers say.
snippet: It is unknown whether the disease is widespread or a blip, researchers say.
lead_paragraph: A mysterious disease is sickening and killing scores of ringed seals along Alaska's north coast. Since late July, about 100 of the animals, which serve as prey for polar bears, have been found with lesions on their flippers and in their mouths; nearly half have died. [Associated Press]

headline.main: On Our Radar: Seals Hit by Baffling Illness
